It is exceptional, occurring mainly after thyroidectomy in the absence of medical preparation. It is an exacerbation of the symptoms of hyperthyroidism, with fever, dehydration, cardiovascular and neuropsychological disorders that can be life-threatening.

question.title: What is an acute thyrotoxic crisis?
question.description: A rare but life-threatening complication of hyperthyroidism

option_a.title: A sudden worsening of hyperthyroidism symptoms
option_a.description: Occurring mainly after thyroidectomy in the absence of medical preparation

option_b.title: A rare complication of thyroidectomy
option_b.description: Causing severe hyperthyroidism symptoms and potentially life-threatening

option_c.title: A rare exacerbation of hyperthyroidism symptoms
option_c.description: Causing fever, dehydration, and cardiovascular disorders

option_d.title: A rare complication of hyperthyroidism treatment
option_d.description: Causing severe symptoms and potentially life-threatening

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: A single letter indicating the correct option
